events.name: Smart Health Futures
events.description: What does the future of health and healthcare look like? How can we use new technologies and data to better manage lifestyles and chronic diseases? What role does IoT, wearables and data collection play in Health 2.0? Learn from experts how innovation is transforming the healthcare industry and hear from startups / SMEs combining tech and data to create new services. Top it off with a Hack Day, where you can work alongside healthcare professionals, technologists, behavioural psychologists and others passionate about this topic to address the issues arising from a changing demographic and the top chronic diseases afflicting Singapore - Type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Register for the Smart Health Futures: http://bit.ly/1FM9yF4 Find out more: http://bit.ly/SHcoLABHome
events.location: 237 (http://237.io/), 237 South Bridge Road Singapore 058786

events.name: Anything with Sound
events.description: Finally we are having another meetup! We are changing the format of our meetup, so instead of people getting up to talk, we will all split off into separate groups and build something based on the theme of the night. Each team will get an hour to an hour and a half to build something and then present it to the group at the end. Bring your laptops so you can build something! Hope to see you all there
events.location: Sonoport, Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #04-18, Singapore

events.name: Tuesday 12th May
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo also. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope!
events.location: TradeGecko Office, 101c Telok Ayer, 068574, Singapore

events.name: Null Singapore Humla - Write your own burp suite plugins
events.description:
Note: This is a free but an invite only event. If you are selected you will receive venue and other information via e-mail. (Laptop is mandatory for participation) 
 
What is null Humla ?  
Null Humla is a hands on workshop where attendees get to get their hands dirty with red team tools and usually held for 3-4 hours. The humla champion will be helping you in understanding and applying the content to real world scenarios.  
  
Humla Champion: Mohammed A Imran 
About Humla Champion - Mohammed A Imran aka secfigo is senior software security engineer at Autodesk and specializes in vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and static code analysis(SAST). He loves to build infosec communities, share his knowledge with the community  and has organized around 60+ secuirty events for the best null chapter, null hyderabad in India. He now leads null Singapore chapter. 
When not at work, he likes to practise his design skills and fiddle with development frameworks. 
  
Details of the workshop: 
1) Introduction to Burp Extender API 
2) Problems with Jython coercion 
3) Hello world Burp plugin 
4) Build, modify and send HTTP requests and retrieve responses 
5) Hows ProxyListener, HTTPListener different   
6) Automate manual efforts while doing assessments 
           - e.g., Automate the process of modifying the signed requests 
7) Work on any specific scenarios which you want to automate.  
   
Prerequisites: 
Knowledge: Fundamentals of OOPS concepts, basic python skills and some experience with burp suite. 
Hardware: Any dual core machine with 4 GB RAM, minimum 20 GB free space. 
Software: Windows 7 x64/ Any Linux Variant , Java 64 bit, Python 2.7 and Jython Standalone, Burp suite professional or Free version. 
Editor : Notepad++ (preferred) or any editor of your choice ( VIM or emacs anyone ;) )  
  
Useful Links: 
We will use windows as our development platform but any platform should do.  
  
Burp suite - http://portswigger.net/burp/download.htmlJython - 
Jython standalone 2.7rc2 version  - http://www.jython.org/downloads.html  
Python 2.7 - https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-279/  
Vmware Player for running Samurai or WTE images - https://my.vmware.com/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_player/7_0  
  
Please reach out to me at morpheus@null.co.in or @secfigo if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.location: TBD, , selected individuals will be informed of thevenue, Singapore null

If you are a designer and want to learn about 3d, visual effects and animations, this event is for you. events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 1: A primer on latency and bandwidth. Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. We'll pool a few dollars from each attendee and order food to have it delivered. Please bring some snacks/drinks to share.

events.name: Data & Tech Workshop - Smart Health coLAB
events.description:
At the Data & Tech Workshop on 12 May, you can learn about the role data and new technologies are playing towards building Health 2.0. What products and services can be empowered by big data, medical devices, the Internet of Things, wearables and other new technologies? Tech leaders will be explaining their technologies and sharing case studies of successful tech!    
It's going to be an exciting week, so don't miss the Smart Health Futures event and the Services Workshop we're organising. Then, top the week off with the Smart Health Hack, where you get to work alongside experts and passionate citizens. Each workshop will have a team formation session, where you can meet other like-minded participants and start forming your teams for the Smart Health Hack!    
PROGRAMME 
Find out more about what's in store for you here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, , 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome!
events.location: Penny Black, 27 Boat Quay, Singapore

events.name: Data Mining with R (Workshop I)
events.description: Hello everyone, At RUGS, we would like to encourage more people to use R, and to use R to do good statistics. As such, Alex and I are organising a series of tutorials on the top data mining algorithms. The content of the talks will aim to cover a little understanding of the theory, but will mostly focus on examples with R. The 8 - 10 algorithms we aim to cover include: • k-means • SVM • Apriori • Naive Bayes • Random forests and decision/regression trees • EM • kNN • AdaBoost We intend for the sessions to be held on a monthly basis, lasting about an hour or so. The venue will be 237 South Bridge Road. We’ll have to collect SGD 5 a head, but this goes toward the venue and refreshments (not into our pockets =)). We'll collect it at the door on the day itself. The speakers for the talks will be our very own RUGS members. If you are an expert in one of the topics and would like to conduct the session, do let us know! For the first talk, Alex will be speaking about SVM. Here is a short overview of the talk, and a little bit about Alex too About SVM: SVM is nowadays one of the most popular classification algorithms. It is efficient in dealing big data set. It allows us to fit nonlinear classification boundary with kernel methods. Moreover, the combination of penalization and “customized” kernel enable us to introduce prior knowledge into classification. In this R share session, we will quickly go through the theoretical part of SVM, and demonstrate the application with R package “kernlab”. And last but not least, we will show 2 examples to let you feel the power of SVM. About Alex: I am a statistician in HSOR@NHG. I have been studying statistics for 6 years and using R for 6 years. My research areas are statistical learning, computing statistics, data visualization and data science with population health management.
events.location: 237 (http://237.io/), 237 South Bridge Road Singapore 058786

events.name: SWUG May Meet Up - Skype for Business 101
events.description: SWUG Meet Up Agenda Date: 13th May 2015 Time: 7.00pm to 9.30pm Venue: 1 Marina Boulevard #21-00,MS Singapore – Level 21 Auditorium 6.30pm: Registration 7.00pm: Session 1 – Skype for Business 101 - What's New? 8.00pm: Networking Session 8.30pm: Home Sweet Home Session 1 – Skype for Business 101 - What's New? (Sarbjit Singh Gill) Abstract: Come to learn the technical aspects of Skype for Business and what’s new for developers, users and IT Pro. I will cover the what’s new from the client perspective, including build and run. Speaker Bio: Sarbjit brings 23 years of IT experience spanning consulting and training for Microsoft infrastructure technologies, including Lync/Skype for Business/Skype, Exchange (development platform included), SharePoint (2001 to 2013 / Yammer, IM/Presence/Voice integration), SQL especially BI/Power BI, Windows Server platform , System Center suites , Security, Identify Management, Integration and Federation and Active Directory – Design / Architect / Optimization / Tuning and Troubleshooting. In the year 2000, he founded his own consulting and provided specialist advice and service to Microsoft and its partners (SIs, ISVs) in Microsoft Technologies. Over the years, Sarbjit also speaks at various Microsoft events both locally and regionally such as TechEd, TechNet, MSDN, product launches and customer/partner initiatives. To show recognition for his efforts and commitment, Sarbjit has been presented with the MVP (Most Valuable Professional) award by Microsoft since 2005 for System Center, SharePoint Server and Microsoft Lync. To date, Sarbjit is the Regional Architect Consultant for MS technologies in Orange Business Services, APAC. In this current capacity, Sarbjit is providing technical insight and strategic direction for Microsoft technologies to both internally and OBS customers.
events.location: Microsoft Singpaore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorum, Singapore 018989

events.name: Hackware v0.7
events.description: Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. Agenda & Talks for this meetup: 1. Amateur Radio 101 - Roland Turner What it is, why it's interesting, and a very brief overview of how radio works. 2. Sense and Sense-abilities - Tan Hwee Xian Lessons from Large-Scale Wireless Sensor Network Deployments​ ( http://sns.i2r.a-star.edu.sg/ ) 3. Intro to Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) - Yeo Kheng Meng BLE is a new technology used for point-to-point communication. Get an intro on how to use the BLE protocol in your devices. Code on Arduino and Android will be covered. FYI - If coming by MRT then the walking route from Esplanade will have more air-con!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: PayrollHero In-House Event: RETAIL HERO
events.description:
Be the rock-star Retail/Store Manager you can be with PayrollHero. 
Discover how PayrollHero can bring happiness and productivity to your business, with our co-founder Steve Jagger as he takes you on a tour of PayrollHero cloud-based time, attendance, scheduling and payroll management software. 
At PayrollHero, we are always excited to meet new people and businesses! 
Come to this FREE in-house event and find out why Singapore retailers love PayrollHero! 
Agenda: 
2.15pm- 2.30pm: Check-In & Welcome 
2.30pm- 3.30pm: 
Identify key problem areas in HR admin and payroll for retail buisnesses 
Do you have problems with time, attendance and scheduling? Do you have trouble managing leave? Is your payroll process painful? 
Learn how PayrollHero can solve these problems for your business 
Introduction to PayrollHero service suite 
Time, Attendance & Scheduling System Leave Management System Payroll Processing Human Resource Information System (HRIS)    PayrollHero Apps to enhance customer and employee experience 
New Customer Feedback app Apply for Jobs app Daily Pulse Feature and more! 
BONUS Intro to PayrollHero Xray Insights! 
Your business intelligence tool to reveal key insights of the inner workings of your company 
3.30pm- 4pm: Questions?   We are ready to answer any questions you’ve got! 
Just a few of our successful clients!
events.location: Ocean Financial Center, , 10 Collyer Quay, #06-07 (BGC Office), Singapore 049315

events.name: Time saving tips using Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign
events.description: ======================== Registration Details (at Xerox Building) ========================= Registration starts from 5.45pm, please proceed immediately to level 1, Fuji Xerox Tower at Anson Road (Tanjong Pagar). This session will start at 6.00pm. ========================= Speakers Bio ========================= Mark Plunkett Adobe Community Professional and Adobe Certified Expert ========================= Meeting Topics ========================= Session 1 Adobe Photoshop CC - Bleeding your images within seconds. - Optimizing dozens of images for print within seconds. - Removing unwanted contents in images within seconds. Session 2 Adobe Illustrator CC - Exporting for print with link files and fonts. - Checking for hidden content duplications instantly. - Using Symbols for quicker edits and faster loading time. - Changing colours easily and quickly. Session 3 Adobe InDesign CC - Ensuring images have sufficient resolution for print. - Links vs Vectors - Checking for printing errors automatically. - Replacing dozens of optimised images within seconds. - Creating page numbers and shuffling of pages instantly. - Packaging artworks for the correct version. ========================= Agenda ========================= 6.00pm - 6.15pm Session 1: Adobe Photoshop 6.15pm - 6.30pm Session 2: Adobe Illustrator 6.30pm - 6.40pm Short break & Refreshments 6.40pm - 7.10pm Session 3: Adobe InDesign 7.10pm - 7.30pm FAQ session ========================= Refreshments ========================= Hot beverages, water and snacks will be provided during the meeting with compliments from Fuji Xerox Singapore. ========================= Facebook ========================= http://www.facebook.com/groups/idugsg/ ========================= Twitter ========================= @InDesignSG ========================= Sponsors ========================= This meeting has been made possible with the generous support of Adobe, Fuji Xerox Singapore and Dexel.
events.location: Fuji Xerox Singapore, 80 Anson Road, Fuji Xerox Towers, S(079907)

events.name: 5th Tableau User Group Singapore Meetup
events.description: Hi Everyone, Based on feedback from the previous meeting, we will be having the next meetup in the evening. We will be starting around 7pm on the 14th of May. Co-working space "The Working Capitol" has generously sponsored one of the workshop rooms for us to organize the 5th Tableau User Group Singapore Meetup The agenda will be as follows. 19:00 Refreshments and Networking 19:25 Welcome and introduction (5 min) 19:30 1st Topic (20min) 19:50 Tableau Announcements / Topics (10min) 20:00 2nd Topic (20min) - Re-viz-it 20:20 3rd Topic (20min) 20:40 Interesting Links, Blogs and Articles (5 min) 20:45 Q&A and Collective Problem Solving (15 min) 21:00 Closing Bring your laptop with Tableau installed, if you have problems, you could show and ask the group, or one-on-one. If you are interested to show your awesome Tableau Visualization, or want to share a really cool trick you found, let us know we can either slot you in for a 10-15 min demo, or we could do it during the Q&A and Collective Problem Solving. One last request : We would like to get to know you a little better. Help us by filling in a quick survey to tell about yourself, and what you would like to see from the Tableau User Group. Singapore Tableau User Group Survey Thanks Richard, Zane and Jimmy TUGS Organizers
events.location: The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089109

Agenda: 1900 - 1930 Registration / Networking 1930 - 2030 Introduction to IBM Bluemix 2030 - 2100 Q&A / Networking If you have anything to share for future events, please contact me!

events.name: *BACK BY POPULAR DEMAND* Complimentary Value Investing Workshop For Beginners
events.description:
*Limited seats are available as we usually keep our group small-- for a more interactive and fufilling session! 
  
Don't be shy! Click to sign up for the early bird tickets and receive a free gift upon registration on the day of the workshop! (Limited to 10 pax only) 
  
The previous workshops were fully filled and we are pleased to announce that everyone who attended learnt the fundamentals of Value Investing and took home financial freedom tips.  
If you'd like to learn the basic of the basics, we sincerely welcome you to join us for the next workshop which will happen on the 14th May 2015 @ 7.30pm for free! One of the questions that we always receive is: Is it really free?  
And we would like to say that our Thursday evenings' workshops are genuinely complimentary because we believe that everyone deserve to have access to proper investing knowledge.  
We do have paid programmes, also known as VIC Bootcamp but these Bootcamps are for people who feel that they need additional support to help them progress towards their financial freedom. Feel free to stay back after the workshop and find out more about our Bootcamp programmes!  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------  
This is going to be one of the most enriching and knowledgable 3 hours of your life! We guarantee that you will walk away with AT LEAST ONE knowledge that will BENEFIT you in future.
events.location: International Plaza, , 10 Anson Road, #36-05A, SINGAPORE 079903

events.name: KOEI TECMO Recruitment Talk
events.description:
Company Background 
KOEI TECMO is one of the world's leading game publishers and developers. Combining the best of KOEI and TECMO, with popular franchises like Dynasty Warriors and Ninja Gaiden, KOEI TECMO leads the way in games with a penchant for spectacular battles, legendary characters and dramatic storylines. New avenues are being explored each new day, into areas where the brightest talents can flourish and make their mark on history. 
Talk Synopsis 
If you are looking to work in a challenging environment with like-minded, highly motivated people, then KOEI TECMO is the place for you! Find out more from this talk on what it takes to be a KOEI TECMO game programmer/designer. Get a glimpse of the exciting work environment and culture of the company, and check out the popular works by KOEI TECMO Singapore. 
Speaker: Mr. Siow Jit-Keong 
Jit-Keong joined KOEI TECMO (then known as KOEI) in 2002 as a programmer and was a member of the pioneer batch who helped establish KOEI TECMO Singapore (then known as KOEI Entertainment Singapore) in 2004. He is currently the manager of the software department, overseeing the department's operational and training matters. 
Jit-Keong has worked on several titles ranging from long-cycled projects such as MMOs and handheld console games to short-cycled casual games, wearing different hats in different projects.
events.location: LT9, ,  NS4-04-39, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore 639798

events.name: Hack Day - Smart Health coLAB
events.description:
The Smart Health Hack Day on Saturday, 16 May, will be a playground for developers, start-up teams, data scientists, and anyone interested in Smart Health to experiment with data, technologies, APIs, devices, and more to create their own prototypes - solutions that might address the challenge of Health 2.0.    
Come meet passionate people working in digital health, technology gurus and expert developers. Share your experience with the less experienced. Form new connections with like-minded innovators.    
If you're already doing smart things with health applications, please email us. We welcome you to come and do a show-and-tell.    
Don't miss the Smart Health Futures event, and the Data & Tech, and Services Workshops we're also organising as part of the Smart Health coLAB. They're an excellent opportunity to inspire ideas and start forming your teams ahead of the Hack Day.    
PROGRAMME 
Find out more about what's in store for you here.

events.name: May Monthly meetup
events.description: After a successful April meetup, here is the details for our may monthly meetup. Agenda ( 45 min talk each) : Introductions and Networking Hypervisor Exploitation and Security by Prasanna K why Penetration Testing sucks by Stefan Streichsbier ( Order of the talk might vary ) Directions to reach venue: Map: Please see the meetup map or follow below street view map. https://www.google.com/maps/@1.280919,103.847042,3a,75y,317.56h,95.79t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sVb_jjHjK7OEtOoaHIfwSpQ!2e0?hl=en Streetdirectory: http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/car-park-amoy-street-a0006/30317_1.html Landmark: Its opposite to Car Park Via MRT: ThoughtWorks(TW) office is 3 mins away from Telok Ayer MRT (DT, purple line) . TW office is 7 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT (green line), take Exit G and take a left till you reach a right turning road and look for 87 B. Abstract of the talk(s): Hypervisor Exploitation and Security 1. Understanding Architecture of Hypervisor. 2. Exploitation Techniques 3. Existing Exploits and Analysis. For the learning we will use the important Hypervisor, XEN. why Penetration Testing sucks This talk will cover why Penetration Testing sucks and what we should be doing instead. Speaker(s) Bio: Stefan has been focusing on information security since 2003. He is passionate about analysing complex applications through source code reviews and improving their security posture. At Vantage Point he is working on revolutionary approaches to integrate security into the development life cycle with the goal to sustainably eradicate vulnerability classes. Prasanna K: I have been a Application Pentester for close to 10 years. Speaker @ nullcon-Delhi, Clubhack, IIT Guwahati and various null meetups. Enjoy solving new challenges. Creator of IronSAP a module over IronWASP. Present interest is in Fuzzing and UAF bugs discovery. Follow us on twitter @nullsingapore and fb at facebook.com/nullsingapore.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: May Meetup
events.description: Our first presentation: P eter Hubert - Head of Insights, APAC LMS @ L inkedIn Peter Hubert is the APAC Head of Insights for LinkedIn Marketing Solutions. He has a passion for information and understanding how data driven evidence can accelerate marketing objectives. Peter began his career in market research before undertaking a five year stint in management consulting across Australia and Asia. In Peter’s role leading the Insights team, he works closely with clients and internal stakeholders to harness the power of big data and embed customized insights and strategic opportunities to power the world's most effective sales and marketing at LinkedIn. How Trending Content is helping LinkedIn to uncover insights Trending content is LinkedIn’s new favourite analytics tool – it’s the powerhouse meta-analysis of all content being consumed on LinkedIn that enables us to track professional content consumption. When we’re able to help you identify what your target audience is reading and engaging with, or conversely which audiences are resonating with a particular topic you are interested in, you can imagine the powerful recommendations we’re able to make to marketers in building and planning their content marketing strategies.
events.location: Hood Bar and Cafe @ Bugis+ (formerly Iluma), Bugis+, 201 Victoria Street, #05-07, Singapore 188067

events.name: May 2015 Data Science Meetup
events.description: UPDATE: Fifteen more days to our meetup and 70 people on the waitlist. For those who've successfully RSVPed but now realise you're unable to attend, may we request for you to change your RSVP to 'No' please? Thank you! Two talks for this particular meetup: 1. IBM: James Pang Topic: Key Technologies behind Business Analytics Bio: Dr. Pang is a Visiting Assistant Professor at the School of Computing, National University of Singapore. He is also a Senior Managing Consultant in IBM with specialty in Analytics and Optimization. Dr. Pang has broad experience inside IBM. Prior to the current role, he was the Client Technical Advisor (Chief Architect, Analytics and Optimization) at IBM Government and Healthcare Center of Competency, and led the IBM technical solution design in ASEAN Public Sector. Before that, he was a Senior Manager at IBM R&D Labs in charge of analytics and optimization product development. Before joining IBM, Dr. Pang was a Research Scientist at Motorola Labs and focused on development and implementation of Operations Research models and methods to solve problems in supply chains and manufacturing systems.Dr. Pang completed his PhD research in Operations Research and System Engineering areas at National University of Singapore (NUS) and Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He completed his Master and Bachelor studies in Engineering at Zhejiang University, China. 2. A*STAR: Alex Chia Synopsis of talk: With the rapid growth in the usage of social networks worldwide, uploading and sharing of user-generated content has become increasingly prevalent. In particular, users are increasingly sharing visual content, often accompanied with limited amount of text. We believe, as social media moves in a more visual direction, monitoring & advertising technologies needs to be more visual. In this talk, we present our technologies which leverage on this new source of data to monitor and track events as well as to profile social media users. Bio: Alex Chia is the Head of Social Media and Internet Vision Analytics Lab and concurrently the Assistant Director of Visual Intelligence Analytics Center of the Institute for Infocomm Research. Dr. Chia was awarded the Tan Sri Dr. Tan Chin Tuan Scholarship in 2004 and the A*STAR Graduate Scholarship in 2006. He was awarded the Tan Kah Kee Young Inventors’ Merit Award and Silver Award in 2009 and 2012 respectively. His research interests include computer vision, image processing and machine learning.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Git Meetup 0.2.0
events.description: It's time for the second meetup! This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute…). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems! Programme: • "Debugging with Git": Ryan Dao • Git is more than just a version control system. It's also one of the best debugging tools if used correctly. In this talk I'm going to show how Git and Delta Debugging can be used to help identity issues in your codebase. • "Interactive rebasing with Git": Jason Chionh • In this short talk, we'll go through the command "git rebase -i". This is git rebasing in interactive mode. You can use it to organize local commit history. Specifically, we'll look at squashing many commits into one commit and re-ordering commits. • Lightning talk: Stashing, yo! Angelo Rohit • One more lightning talk, anyone? Come merge with your fellow Gits! Interested in speaking? Please leave a message in this group! (We're looking for lightning talks!) Venue and food sponsor: Autodesk (thanks guys!)
events.location: Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd, 1 Fusionopolis Walk, #04-11 Solaris North Tower, Singapore

Soft drinks and beer will be available for Bitcoin and fiat. See you! Tomas

events.name: Tour to Prefabricated Software-Defined Data Center
events.description:
We will visit a unique & futuristic data center ever built in Singapore and totally different from any traditional data center. We will tour inside its data center and see ourselves how software-defined data center works in real time. You will learn unique technical aspects of power, cooling, cabling, security, fire system in this data center. There will be more data centers to be built with this kind of technological concept. If you want to be in the data center industry for many years to come, you absolutely should not miss this tour. 



You are required to provide your name, NRIC, car plate (if park inside the facility) together with this registration. Without this info the security guard will not allow you to enter the facility. 


The tour is free. 


Disclaimer: This tour is not intended for sales pitch, although it is sponsored by companies. The sponsor may collect your information for their future communication. You can always opt out. 


Please come on time. We may not have a presentation so whoever comes first can start asking questions to the executives. We will keep interactive session until around 3:30pm, then we will tour inside the facility for about 45 minutes. Then we'll stay back for networking until 5pm. If you come later than 3:30pm, you should wait at the security guard until we finish the tour and there will be no repeat tour. As this facility is highly secured, we are always escorted at all time. 


Please bring enough namecards for networking. This meetup is your opportunity to build your networks. 


  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
Yes, you must provide your name & NRIC upon booking.  Also your car plate (if park inside the facility).  Without pre-registering your ID, the security guard will not allow you to enter the facility.  If you are not willing to provide your ID, it is better not to join this tour.  The facility is not a public place.  The tour is strictly for professionals whose work are related to data centre.   
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
You can take public bus or taxi. 
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable?  Can I just show up at the site? 
Not transferrable.  Not sudden show up.
events.location: IO, , 7000 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 5, Singapore null

events.name: RMASG Running Games 2015
events.description:
In lieu of the upcoming SEA Games in Singapore, we are holding a special theme for our games. We have picked 3 type of sports and tweaked it Runningman style just for this event! So come on down properly dressed and be mentally prepared for a day of running!! 
*Rental Prices 



Category
Price Per Runner




First Timer Runners
$3


Repeat Runners
$5


Partial members  (reg. w/o gear) 
$3


Friend referrals (if you bring 8< friends) 
$2



  
    
FAQs 
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
Yes. ALL of our events are open to runners aged 16 - 35. This is to ensure safety of runners. 
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
We advise ALL our runners to carry as light as possible reason being we may not have rooms or dedicated places for you to carry your bags/belongings whilst the games are in progress. 
Items such as your wallet, mobile phone, extra clothes and a cap. 
Where can I contact the organiser with any questions? 
You may wish to contact us via email at rmasg.main@gmail.com 
Can I update my registration information? 
Yes you may. 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You do not need to print and bring your ticket physically. As we are going green, we advise runners to save the PDF of the ticket and present it upon check-in at the event itself. 
What is the refund policy? 
There shall be no refund upon any form of payment made via any modes of payment such as online banking or cash. In lieu of a cancelled event, any form of payment received shall be brought over to the next event. 
Do I need to register for every event announced via RMASG Club Facebook Page? 
You MUST only register if you are interested to participate in the games we organize. Each registration is only valid for the event you are attending. Any subsequent events organized by us you will need to register again to facilitate with necessary data information. 
What is the proper basic attire? 
We require ALL participants to wear; 
Shorts that pass the knees OR long sports pants. 
Tight/Skinny jeans are NOT allowed. Torn pants are NOT allowed.  Shorts that does not cover 3/4 of your legs are NOT allowed. This is to ensure your safety. 
As safety is our No. 1 priority, failure to comply will deny you from entry to the event and no refunds will be given. 
 Is it possible to keep any kits supplied by the club after gameplay? 
 NO. Participants are charged with rental fees for both tee and tag. If under any circumstances that you are to bring home our stock gear, we will impose a chargeable fee of $22 for the stock gear.

events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. 24 May 2015, Sunday, 1pm – 7pm ArtScience Galleries, Level 4 FREE Amplified! The Best of the School of Art, Design and Media Nanyang Technological University Final Year students from the School of Art, Design and Media present a vibrant selection of creative works across and between disciplines, media and technology, including graphic and product design, interactive installations and animation.

events.name: Reactive Programming Coursera - Weekly coding session
events.description: We are a group of passionate developers following the Reactive Programming course on coursera ( https://class.coursera.org/reactive-002 ). Come down and have a bit of fun coding the assignments with us! If you're doing the course and want to discuss the concepts, have gotten stuck on some syntax/integration issue or just want some motivation and dedicated Scala time then join us for an evening. Please try and watch the week's lectures beforehand. It's also a good idea if you download the dependencies beforehand too. (Though Lowercase cafe has good WiFi, so if you need to, you can setup your environment once you get here.)
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: Ethereum Visits Singapore
events.description: Join us for this Two-day event to learn more about block chain 2.0 technology and how it applies to the real world. We will provide an introduction to block chain technology and it's use cases apart from bitcoin. The second day of the event will be a coding workshop for everyone of all skill levels to participate and see what kind of interesting programs they can come up with on the block chain. Gavin Wood (Co-Founder of Ethereum), George Hallam and Ken Kappler will be speaking, and we will have live video conferences with a few start ups on the block chain, ie www.provenance.org. DigixGlobal (www.dgx.io), the first smart asset company built on Ethereum's block chain, will be helping to host the event. Calvin Soh will also be guest speaking. He was a creative director for several mnc ad agencies and is currently a branding and marketing consultant for innovative technologies. Amazing dinner will be served so come with empty stomachs and open minds! Spaces are limited so please sign up for this free and informative event!
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Economics, Level 4, Seminar Room 4.3, 90 Stamford Road, Singapore Management University, 178903

Come join us to learn about and discuss the most exciting space in computing technology. ------------------ Speakers ------------------ We've invited Institute of Mental Health to present the VR system for the upcoming meetup. They have developed for the children with selective mutism. ------------------ Agenda ------------------ 1. Get to know everyone 2. Topics : VR Therapy for selective mutism children by Zi Jun and Clare Kwan Hui Min from Instituted of Mental health (IMH) 3D Scanner review by Sydney Wu 3. AR/VR project pitch. 4. Getting feedback! ------------------ Location #03-04, IDA Labs @ National Design Centre ------------------

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: We will be holding a HEBOCON challenge as part of the South East Asia Makerspace Summit scheduled to be held from 5-7 June 2015. Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. This event will serve as a testbed for the organizers to improve the competition processes leading to the HEBOCON main event in July. Thank you. For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official

events.name: ETSY Craft Party 2015 SINGAPORE
events.description:
Etsy is a marketplace where people around the world connect, both online and offline, make, sell and buy unique goods. Since 2010, Etsy has hosted Etsy Craft Party, a global celebration of meeting and making.  
This is the 3rd party in Singapore and we would like to invite you to come and celebrate this big day with us. Consider it like a Handmade Craft Holiday! 
This year's theme is Kaleidoscope: Paper Taking Shape. We will explore and make a few crafts with paper. How many pieces of papers form a picture? Let's create a variety of collage and paper cutting techniques. One of the crafts we'll be making is paper weaving. Combine your favorite images with embellishments like ribbon, yarn, colored paper, magazine pages, or even your child’s artwork, and you’ll have a one-of-a-kind statement piece to display in your home. 
ETSY CRAFT PARTY 
6 June 2015 
Time: 2-6pm 
Place: The Playtent  
Sign up today to find out what other fun crafts we will be making on the 6th! 
https://www.etsy.com/local/craftparty/event/23279223368/etsy-craft-party-2015-singapore-june-6 
BUT secure your seat through payment on this Eventbrite page. We can only take in those who have RSVP-ed and make payment. 
Add us on FB or instagram @simply4love and join our FB Group here 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/etsycraftivistsg/ 
For any questions, please email us at simply4love@ymail.com or whatapp 90670847. 
See you soon! 
#craftparty @etsy
events.location: The Playtent, , 180 Joo Chiat Road #02-01, Singapore 427451

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899
